1454088740549373952.text:
All of this is Open source and if you are interested in learning more, reach out or come join our community.

https://t.co/9fqHoZ9JU0

With AsyncAPI spec and tools we believe we can help our community document, discover, and build better event driven applications.

1454088737936351246.text:
Also, I'm working on a feature idea at the moment that gives people examples of using the studio for the first time. 

If you have no idea what @AsyncAPISpec is, this stuff can hopefully help and help you explore different protocols and real-world examples. https://t.co/LrQkBq8C5v

1454088732555063296.text:
As we have WebSocket support, @smoyac came up with the idea of cross-collaboration of your files with your team.

Imagine editing files together in real-time and seeing these changes in the studio üòç https://t.co/qTIIlkJ2tD

1454088728553660416.text:
Here @fmvilas shows us you can still use your editor of choice whilst getting all the benefits of our studio locally.

We use WebSockets to manage communication between files.

Edit in VSCode and See your changes in real-time in the studio üòç

https://t.co/4gIyu0PNrG

1454088725919670273.text:
If you like to see your AsyncAPI visually you can use our visualizer that will show you how your application is connected. 

Shows you how to publish or subscribe from your application. https://t.co/XlxyXfWA4Y

1454088719946993672.text: You can write/edit your AsyncAPI file in the browser and see file render in our html docs as you go. https://t.co/fAWo2begQW

1454088714620129283.text:
Over at @AsyncAPISpec we have been working on a new Studio that allows you to build and explore your AsyncAPI files.

This is the initial release and we hope to be adding more ideas/modules in the future.

https://t.co/aMUL2Gkis3

Some features documented below üëá https://t.co/1NDNvsdMXn

1453994847745028096.text:
@leeerob Would love to understand more benefits and patterns using URL imports vs npm packages.

I guess one I can think of is the ability to update packages/widgets using url imports, without the need to update packages / build your website?

1453691840553758730.text:
For example, pick your favourite lib/tool/framework.

Just start from the top and work your way down, you will come across all sorts of patterns and wonderful (and not so wonderful) things!

1453691839123496965.text:
One of the best things about working with open source code full time is the amount of stuff I'm learning.

New patterns, designs, architectures, packages, and more!

I said it before, but if you want to learn new things, literally just go to GitHub and start reading code üìñ

1453287862632394759.text:
I love the innovation here.

https://t.co/rlAsqMMrT2 https://t.co/NtuXzNBvbh

1453101816447655940.text:
HTTP requests are a stream of events from request to response.

This is how I visualize them in my head üëá

I'm exploring building a new tool that allows us to create API's with graph nodes and streams.

Connect nodes and get a real API in return... https://t.co/XOxy3BxGkI

1453053167978041352.text:
reduce all things.

Seriously it's my favourite function by far.

Also this visual from @codingyuri is great! https://t.co/Gjk5n0bWwD

1452654618874368004.text:
Over at @AsyncAPISpec @fmvilas has been playing around with Spec's first approach for building event-driven applications.

In theory, it allows us to:

‚Ä¢ Define spec 
‚Ä¢ Just focus on business logic
‚Ä¢ Profit

Check out the video üëá

https://t.co/YuxkjdKJhJ

1451539495136997379.text:
This is just an initial thought of how I think @AsyncAPISpec can help us in the Serverless world.

I believe the spec can be used to help describe and visualize our events/architecture.

Most things in AWS are event-driven. There is huge value to documenting the systems we build https://t.co/mXIc6F8eZs

1451280938776793088.text:
I've been playing around with flow diagrams for Event systems recently, but here is a model for HTTP.

Here is an example of an idea where you can use blocks to create mock endpoints.

Just POC but you could pipe blocks into each other...ü§î

Just a thought ü§£ https://t.co/rlIOpL0Or7
